node.title: U.S.-born figure skater representing China attacked online after falling during Olympics debut
node.description: The 19-year-old, who was born in California, changed her name and gave up her American citizenship to compete for China.
node.content: ["Chinese figure skater Zhu Yi has faced vitriol online after she fell during her debut performance at the Beijing Winter Olympics.\u00a0The 19-year-old, who was born in California, gave up her American citizenship to compete for China.", "The teen left the skating rink at Capital Indoor Stadium in tears Monday after she fell twice during the free skate event, part of women's team competition. China finished fifth in the event.\u00a0", "Her latest performance comes a day after Zhu failed to complete her opening combination in the women's short program, stumbled and\u00a0crashed into a wall. She finished last, dropping China's position from third to fifth in the team standings. Following her Sunday performance, Zhu told the South China Morning Post\u00a0that she was \"upset and a little embarrassed.\"", "\"I guess I felt a lot of pressure because I know everybody in China was pretty surprised with the selection for ladies' singles and I just really wanted to show them what I was able to do but unfortunately I didn't,\" she said.\u00a0", "She instead faced fans' ire on Weibo, a social media platform predominantly used in China. Users called her an\u00a0\"embarrassment\"\u00a0and others justified the attacks online, saying she\u00a0\"deserves it.\"", "Zhu's participation was controversial before she stepped on the ice representing the Chinese flag. Some Weibo users took issue with her not knowing how to speak Chinese fluently and spouted conspiracy theories that she was only chosen to compete for China because of her father, Song-Chun Zhu, a well-regarded Chinese artificial intelligence professor who teaches at the University of California, Los Angeles.\u00a0", "Zhu, who was born with the name Beverly before changing it to Yi in 2018, will have her chance at redemption on February 15 when she will compete in the singles competition.\u00a0", "As of Monday morning Eastern Time, host China has two gold and two silver medals. The United States has yet to grab its first gold medal of the Beijing Games.\u00a0", "Shuai Zhang contributed.", "Christopher Brito is a social media producer and trending writer for CBS News, focusing on sports and stories that involve issues of race and culture."]
